JMicron SATA/IDE controllers are often incompatible with [[Linux]] distributions<ref>[http://www.mepislovers.org/forums/showthread.php?t=1451] Incompatibilities reports</ref>. In particular, those using [[GNU GRUB|GRUB]], such as [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]], cannot boot in some conditions<ref>[https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/57502] Ubuntu bug listing of incompatibility with JMicron</ref>. The most recent Linux kernel and the most recent JMicron controller BIOS <ref>[http://www.jmicron.com/Support_FAQ.html] JMicron FAQ stating newer BIOS software will work with Linux</ref> solve these incompatibilities but may not be present in existing products, requiring a flash of the motherboard BIOS if the newer version contains the JMicron BIOS update. This will work for [[ASUS]] boards but no such update exists for some MSI boards e.g. the MSI P965 Neo-F. The JMicron incompatibility with [[GNU GRUB]], [[LILO]] and [[Super GRUB]] combined with no route for updating the BIOS makes the JMicron controller on these MSI boards completely incompatible with GNU/Linux for booting; however, using a separate card-based ATA controller or one of the integrated SATA slots allows Linux to boot, and once booted, the JMicron controlled disks are now visible due to the updated Linux kernel.

JMicron SATA/IDE controllers are often incompatible with [[Linux]] distributions<ref>[http://www.mepislovers.org/forums/showthread.php?t=1451] Incompatibilities reports</ref>. In particular, those using [[GNU GRUB|GRUB]], such as [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], cannot boot in some conditions<ref>[https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/57502] Ubuntu bug listing of incompatibility with JMicron</ref>. The most recent Linux kernel and the most recent JMicron controller BIOS <ref>[http://www.jmicron.com/Support_FAQ.html] JMicron FAQ stating newer BIOS software will work with Linux</ref> solve these incompatibilities but may not be present in existing products, requiring a flash of the motherboard BIOS if the newer version contains the JMicron BIOS update. This will work for [[ASUS]] boards but no such update exists for some MSI boards e.g. the MSI P965 Neo-F. The JMicron incompatibility with [[GNU GRUB]], [[LILO]] and [[Super GRUB]] combined with no route for updating the BIOS makes the JMicron controller on these MSI boards completely incompatible with GNU/Linux for booting; however, using a separate card-based ATA controller or one of the integrated SATA slots allows Linux to boot, and once booted, the JMicron controlled disks are now visible due to the updated Linux kernel.
